translated: Amarako·π£·π≠hƒ´kƒÅ-kƒÅmadhenunƒÅma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'chi ba med pa'i mdzod kyi rgya cher 'grel pa 'dod 'jo'i ba mo zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa'i mdzod kyi rgya cher 'grel pa 'dod 'jo'i ba mo zhes bya ba /
translated: The Great Commentary on the Treasury of Immortality called the Wish-Fulfilling Cow

original: bcom ldan 'das gsung gi dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gsung gi dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Lord of Speech.

original: sa mchog chen po brnyes las 'khrungs //
analyzed: sa mchog chen po brnyes las 'khrungs //
translated: Born from the one who has attained the great supreme stage,

original: bdud rtsi rdzu 'phrul yal 'dab ldan //
analyzed: bdud rtsi rdzu 'phrul yal 'dab ldan //
translated: The nectar tree with branches of miracles,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dpag bsam shing //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dpag bsam shing //
translated: The wish-fulfilling tree of omniscience,üîΩMay it be for you like a flower and fruit.

original: khyed la me tog 'bras bur shog / gang g'a'i chu bo rab 'bab bzhin //
analyzed: khyed la me tog 'bras bur shog / gang g'a'i chu bo rab 'bab bzhin //
translated: Like the flowing waters of the Ganges,

original: gang gi thugs rje lam gsum gshegs //
analyzed: gang gi thugs rje lam gsum gshegs //
translated: Whose compassion travels the three paths,

original: dpal gyi rgya mtsho bdud rtsi'i gter //
analyzed: dpal gyi rgya mtsho bdud rtsi'i gter //
translated: The ocean of glory, a treasure of nectar,

original: srid pa'i zla phyed bdag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: srid pa'i zla phyed bdag phyag 'tshal //
translated: I bow to the crescent moon of existence.

original: srid pa'i mtsho chen de las sgrol byed chos kyi gru //
analyzed: srid pa'i mtsho chen de las sgrol byed chos kyi gru //
translated: The boat of Dharma that liberates from that great ocean of existence,

original: snying rje'i dpag bsam ljon pa'i shing las grub gyur pa //
analyzed: snying rje'i dpag bsam ljon pa'i shing las grub gyur pa //
translated: Created from the wish-fulfilling tree of compassion,

original: rab tu dang sems dad pa'i skya ba rab bskyod de //
analyzed: rab tu dang sems dad pa'i skya ba rab bskyod de //
translated: With the oars of pure faith and devotion well-rowed,

original: pha rol phyin nas mngon 'dod rin chen thob par shog / bung bas me tog rtsi blangs thigs pa rab bsags ltar //
analyzed: pha rol phyin nas mngon 'dod rin chen thob par shog / bung bas me tog rtsi blangs thigs pa rab bsags ltar //
translated: Just as bees collect honey from flowers,

original: gang zhig blo gros bzang po'i btung ba 'jo zhing ster //
analyzed: gang zhig blo gros bzang po'i btung ba 'jo zhing ster //
translated: The one who extracts and gives the drink of good intelligence,

original: snyan dngags mkhan dbang yid 'ong gtsug gi me tog bzhin //
analyzed: snyan dngags mkhan dbang yid 'ong gtsug gi me tog bzhin //
translated: Like the beautiful crest jewel of the lord of poets,

original: dpal ldan 'chi med gsung pa de nyid gcig pu rgyal //üîΩmtha' yas rgyud kyi mngon brjod chu gter rin chen gang //
analyzed: dpal ldan 'chi med gsung pa de nyid gcig pu rgyal // mtha' yas rgyud kyi mngon brjod chu gter rin chen gang //
translated: The glorious immortal speaker, alone is victorious.üîΩThe ocean of jewels of the tantra's expression,

original: snyan dngags mgrin pa'i do shal bang mdzod rnam bkod rnams //
analyzed: snyan dngags mgrin pa'i do shal bang mdzod rnam bkod rnams //
translated: The necklace of poetry, the treasury of arrangements,

original: dpal ldan tsanda go mis sbyar ba'ang phul byung mod //
analyzed: dpal ldan tsanda go mis sbyar ba'ang phul byung mod //
translated: Even the composition of glorious Candragomin is excellent.

original: des na rab tu bsgrub pa'i cho ga bdag gis brtsam //
analyzed: des na rab tu bsgrub pa'i cho ga bdag gis brtsam //
translated: Therefore, I will compose the ritual of practice.

original: de nas gzhan la phan pa rjes su ston pas sdig pa rab tu zhi ba dang // bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa bsag pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kun tu bzang po la mchod par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nas gzhan la phan pa rjes su ston pas sdig pa rab tu zhi ba dang // bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa bsag pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kun tu bzang po la mchod par brjod pa ni /
translated: Then, in order to show benefit to others, to pacify evil, and to accumulate perfect merit, I will praise the Blessed One Samantabhadra:

original: gang gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: gang gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: The one who is so described is the Bhagavat Buddha.

original: mkhyen pa ni yul gyi dngos po mtha' dag yongs su mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa ni yul gyi dngos po mtha' dag yongs su mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the complete knowledge of all the things that are objects.

original: brtse ba ni sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'don par bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: brtse ba ni sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'don par bzhed pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the desire to completely liberate from suffering.

original: de gnyis ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas rgya mtsho ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas rgya mtsho ste /
translated: Those two are like an ocean, thus it is an ocean.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de'i mkhyen pa dang brtse ba ni rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de'i mkhyen pa dang brtse ba ni rgya mtsho'o //
translated: The knowledge and compassion of that Bhagavat Buddha is an ocean.

original: 'dir rgya mtsho'i sgras gting med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mtshungs pa nye bar 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgya mtsho'i sgras gting med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mtshungs pa nye bar 'jal ba'o //
translated: Here, the word ocean is a comparison to the similarity of qualities such as being unfathomable.

original: mkhyen pa dang brtse bas byas pa de ni gting med pa la sogs pa can zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang brtse bas byas pa de ni gting med pa la sogs pa can zhes pa ste /
translated: That which is done by knowledge and compassion is unfathomable, etc.

original: byed pa po la mang po'o zhes pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa po la mang po'o zhes pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The plural in the agent is a genitive tatpurusa compound.

original: bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i don can yin pa'i phyir 'dir dgos pa med do //
analyzed: bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i don can yin pa'i phyir 'dir dgos pa med do //
translated: The action is not necessary here because it has a future meaning.

original: mkhyen pa dang brtse ba dag ni rgya @245a * //
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang brtse ba dag ni rgya @245a * //
translated: Knowledge and compassion are an ocean.

original: mtsho'o zhes bshad pa ni byed pa po sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: mtsho'o zhes bshad pa ni byed pa po sgrub pa ste /
translated: This is the establishment of the agent.

original: de'i tshig mi mngon pa'am yang na drug pa 'brel pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshig mi mngon pa'am yang na drug pa 'brel pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The words of this verse are not clear.

original: mkhyen pa dang brtse ba dag ni rgya mtsho lta bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang brtse ba dag ni rgya mtsho lta bur gyur pa ste /
translated: His knowledge and compassion are like an ocean.

original: rgya mtsho ni gzhi yangs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho ni gzhi yangs pa'o //
translated: An ocean is a vast expanse.

original: rgya mtsho ni brtan zhing yangs pa'o zhes lha rnams la rab tu grags so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho ni brtan zhing yangs pa'o zhes lha rnams la rab tu grags so //
translated: It is well known to the gods that an ocean is stable and vast.

original: gting med pa ni gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gting med pa ni gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is fathomless, since it cannot be fathomed by others.

original: gang gi mkhyen pa dang brtse ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol zab mo yongs su dpyod mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi mkhyen pa dang brtse ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol zab mo yongs su dpyod mi nus pa'o //
translated: The profound other shore of the ocean of his knowledge and compassion cannot be fathomed.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das de'i mkhyen pa dang brtse ba shes bya'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag la khyab pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das de'i mkhyen pa dang brtse ba shes bya'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag la khyab pas /
translated: Since the knowledge and compassion of the Bhagavat pervade the entire sphere of the knowable,

original: gang yang sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho gting mtha' med pa skyabs med pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyis mngon par khyab cing gang ba de dag gang gis mthar thug par sgrol nus pa de lta bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sdig med de /
analyzed: gang yang sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho gting mtha' med pa skyabs med pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyis mngon par khyab cing gang ba de dag gang gis mthar thug par sgrol nus pa de lta bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sdig med de /
translated: he is able to deliver those who are completely immersed in the fathomless, boundless ocean of suffering, those who are helpless and submerged in it.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams spangs pa'o //üîΩyon tan ni byams pa dang bzod pa dang nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams spangs pa'o // yon tan ni byams pa dang bzod pa dang nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: gu na bod pa la'o zhes pa aata mtha' can gyi byings tsur sogs kyi lhag ma yin te / tshogs dang bcas pa yongs su ma rdzogs par brita byas pas so //

original: khyad par du 'phags pa don dam pa grub pa'i phyir du brtse ba dang blos pha rol tu son pa tshol bar byed pa dang mchog gi snying rje la sogs pa yon tan chen po de lta bu ni gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba yang dag par
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa don dam pa grub pa'i phyir du brtse ba dang blos pha rol tu son pa tshol bar byed pa dang mchog gi snying rje la sogs pa yon tan chen po de lta bu ni gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba yang dag par
translated: The suffix -na makes it a noun, and the suffix -ka makes

original: sgrub pa la zad pa mi mnga' zhing bsnyel ba mi mnga' bas na mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa la zad pa mi mnga' zhing bsnyel ba mi mnga' bas na mi zad pa'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible because it is never exhausted in its practice and is never subject to forgetfulness.

original: yang na 'khor bar gnas pa nyid na yang 'di la rga shi mi mnga' bas mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'khor bar gnas pa nyid na yang 'di la rga shi mi mnga' bas mi zad pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is inexhaustible because, even while remaining in cyclic existence, it is not subject to old age and death.

original: gting med pa ni rgya mtsho'i mthil la mi reg pa nyid do //
analyzed: gting med pa ni rgya mtsho'i mthil la mi reg pa nyid do //
translated: It is fathomless because its depths cannot be reached.

original: sdig med kyi yon tan nyid rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur pas na mi zad pa ste yongs su gang ba nyid do //
analyzed: sdig med kyi yon tan nyid rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur pas na mi zad pa ste yongs su gang ba nyid do //
translated: It is inexhaustible because it is the source of the jewel of the good qualities of the absence of evil, and it is full because it is completely full.

original: skye bo mtha' dag 'bras bu la gzhol bar rab tu 'dzud pas na rab tu 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ston to //
analyzed: skye bo mtha' dag 'bras bu la gzhol bar rab tu 'dzud pas na rab tu 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ston to //
translated: It shows the result of engagement because it causes all beings to engage in the result.

original: dpal dang bdud rtsi'i phyir du yang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dpal dang bdud rtsi'i phyir du yang zhes pa ni /
translated: For the sake of glory and nectar,

original: 'tshed pa'i phyir du 'gro bar byed pa bzhin du de'i don nyid la bzhi pa'i rnam dbye'o //
analyzed: 'tshed pa'i phyir du 'gro bar byed pa bzhin du de'i don nyid la bzhi pa'i rnam dbye'o //
translated: The fourth case is used in the sense of going for the sake of cooking.

original: gang gi yi ge ni phan tshun sdud pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi yi ge ni phan tshun sdud pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word of which is the word for mutual inclusion.

original: dpal ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Glory is excellence.

original: bdud @245b rtsi'i ched du zhes pa bcud len gyi phyir bsten pa'o //
analyzed: bdud @245b rtsi'i ched du zhes pa bcud len gyi phyir bsten pa'o //
translated: For the sake of nectar means to rely for the sake of elixirs.

original: mkhyen pa dang brtse ba'i rgya mtsho ni srid par bde ba 'dod pa'i mkhas pa rnams kyis dpal gyi phyir te /
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang brtse ba'i rgya mtsho ni srid par bde ba 'dod pa'i mkhas pa rnams kyis dpal gyi phyir te /
translated: The ocean of knowledge and love is to be relied upon by the wise who desire happiness in cyclic existence for the sake of glory,

original: sde tshan gsum gyi phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir dang / thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis bdud rtsi'i phyir te thar pa'i ched du bsten par bya ba nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sde tshan gsum gyi phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir dang / thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis bdud rtsi'i phyir te thar pa'i ched du bsten par bya ba nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: for the sake of the excellence of the three sets of qualities, and by those who desire liberation for the sake of nectar, for the sake of liberation.

original: 'dir mkhyen pa dang brtse ba'i rgya mtsho la sogs pa rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa sems can thams cad la rgyu med par mchog tu mnyes gshin pa'i rang bzhin can bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa de nyid nye bar mtshon par byed pas na //
analyzed: 'dir mkhyen pa dang brtse ba'i rgya mtsho la sogs pa rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa sems can thams cad la rgyu med par mchog tu mnyes gshin pa'i rang bzhin can bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa de nyid nye bar mtshon par byed pas na //
translated: Here, the Bhagavat, the Sugata, who is the ocean of knowledge and love, and so on, is indicated by the words ‚Äúthe omniscient one,‚Äù ‚Äúthe supremely compassionate one,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe one who is naturally loving toward all sentient beings without cause.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rab tu dangs pa zhes bya ba'i snyan dngags kyi yon tan te /üîΩji skad du /
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu dangs pa zhes bya ba'i snyan dngags kyi yon tan te / ji skad du /
translated: This is the poetic ornament called ‚Äúclarity.‚Äù

original: dbyangs can gyi mgul rgyan gyi snyan dngags kyi rgyan las /üîΩgang gi don ni rab gsal ba //
analyzed: dbyangs can gyi mgul rgyan gyi snyan dngags kyi rgyan las / gang gi don ni rab gsal ba //
translated: As it says in Sarasvatƒ´‚Äôs Ornament of Poetics:üîΩWhen the meaning is clear,

original: de ni rab tu dangs par brjod //
analyzed: de ni rab tu dangs par brjod //
translated: that is called clarity.

original: dper na / 'di shar gyur pas rgya grol padma can rnams rgyas gyur cing //
analyzed: dper na / 'di shar gyur pas rgya grol padma can rnams rgyas gyur cing //
translated: When it rises, the lotus garden opens,

original: ri dang nags tshal mand'a ra ba'i me tog gzhon nu bzhin //üîΩdur ba lhan cig mi gnas rab tu bcom zhing gnyis gnyis gnyen //
analyzed: ri dang nags tshal mand'a ra ba'i me tog gzhon nu bzhin // dur ba lhan cig mi gnas rab tu bcom zhing gnyis gnyis gnyen //
translated: And the mountains, forests, and fresh mandara flowersüîΩAre like a young woman.

original: spre'u rab tu khros pas mkhur tshos 'gram pa zangs mdog bzhin //
analyzed: spre'u rab tu khros pas mkhur tshos 'gram pa zangs mdog bzhin //
translated: The angry monkey's cheeks and lips are copper-colored.

original: zhes pa 'dir mun pa bsal bas dur ba'i mya ngan bsal te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir mun pa bsal bas dur ba'i mya ngan bsal te /
translated: Here, by dispelling darkness, the sorrow of darkness is dispelled.

original: dur pa pho mo mtshan mo lhan cig mi gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: dur pa pho mo mtshan mo lhan cig mi gnas pa yin la /
translated: Male and female crows do not stay together at night.

original: de la sogs pa bsal bas /
analyzed: de la sogs pa bsal bas /
translated: By dispelling these and so on,

original: nyi ma'i mtshan nyid ma bshad kyang don gyis rab tu gsal bar mtshon par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nyi ma'i mtshan nyid ma bshad kyang don gyis rab tu gsal bar mtshon par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: Even without explaining the characteristics of the sun, it is clearly illustrated by implication.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di bstan bcos la yang sbyar te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di bstan bcos la yang sbyar te /
translated: This verse is also applied to the treatise.

original: 'dir snyan dngags smra ba nyid kyis dang por rigs pa'i gnas mtha' dag la shes pas sbyin pa dang / de'i dpal ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir snyan dngags smra ba nyid kyis dang por rigs pa'i gnas mtha' dag la shes pas sbyin pa dang / de'i dpal ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Here, by being a poet, first the knowledge of all fields of knowledge is given, and its glory is perfect.

original: shes pa sbyin pa nyid kyis phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: shes pa sbyin pa nyid kyis phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas /
translated: The treatise is like an ocean because it is the cause of the perfection of the generosity of knowledge.

original: rgya mtsho ste bstan bcos so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho ste bstan bcos so //
translated: The treatise is an ocean.

original: 'di ni rgyu'i gzugs can gyi rgyan te /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu'i gzugs can gyi rgyan te /
translated: This is the causal ornament.

original: ji ltar / zab pas rgya mtsho dang mtshungs zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar / zab pas rgya mtsho dang mtshungs zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the verse, ‚ÄúBecause of its profundity, it is like an ocean.‚Äù

original: de'i gting med pa nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas mtshungs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i gting med pa nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas mtshungs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Its lack of depth is its incomparability because of the possession of the qualities as previously explained.

original: sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba rnams la sdig pa zhes mngon par brjod de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba rnams la sdig pa zhes mngon par brjod de /
translated: For those afflicted by suffering, it is a ‚Äúsin‚Äù because it is a cause of suffering.

original: sdig med ni yon tan nyid dang / bde ba'i rgyur nyung ba dang gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdig med ni yon tan nyid dang / bde ba'i rgyur nyung ba dang gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The absence of sin is a quality and a cause of happiness.

original: bsten pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang 'chad pa la sogs pas so //üîΩmi zad pa ni yang dag par @246a * //
analyzed: bsten pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang 'chad pa la sogs pas so // mi zad pa ni yang dag par @246a * //
translated: It is ‚Äúto be relied upon‚Äù through listening, reflection, and explanation.

original: rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: It is ‚Äúinexhaustible‚Äù because it is perfect.

original: yang na ming gi sgra thams cad kyi go rims dang / rtags gsal bar brjod pa'i go rims kyi tshad do //
analyzed: yang na ming gi sgra thams cad kyi go rims dang / rtags gsal bar brjod pa'i go rims kyi tshad do //
translated: Or, it is the measure of the order of all verbal sounds and the order of the expression of clear signs.

original: 'di ltar las dang mngon par 'dod pa dag la de yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar las dang mngon par 'dod pa dag la de yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa'o //
translated: Thus, he is the one who gives to them the karma and the desired objects.

original: gang yang las dang byed pa po dag las aa na dag go //
analyzed: gang yang las dang byed pa po dag las aa na dag go //
translated: And also, the karma and the agent are from the letters.

original: de la 'dir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i thos pa'i don gyi go rims nyid rgya mtsho'i sgra ste de ni rtags zhes nges par bstan te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i thos pa'i don gyi go rims nyid rgya mtsho'i sgra ste de ni rtags zhes nges par bstan te /
translated: Here, the sound of the ocean is the order of the meaning of the scriptures in the desire realm. That is taught to be the sign.

original: ming dang rtags rjes su bstan pa'i sgra'i'o //
analyzed: ming dang rtags rjes su bstan pa'i sgra'i'o //
translated: It is the sound of the teaching of names and signs.

original: dpal ni sde tshan gsum gyi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ni sde tshan gsum gyi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Glory is the perfection of the three groups.

original: de yang slob dpon by'a das /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon by'a das /
translated: And the master BhƒÅviveka says:

original: dpal dang dbyangs dang blo yi sde gsum gyi //
analyzed: dpal dang dbyangs dang blo yi sde gsum gyi //
translated: The three perfections of glory, melody, and intelligence

original: phun tshogs 'byor bas mdzes par 'gyur rnams la //
analyzed: phun tshogs 'byor bas mdzes par 'gyur rnams la //
translated: are beautified by the wealth of perfection.

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i yo byad gang yin pa'i //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i yo byad gang yin pa'i //
translated: Whatever is the equipment of fearlessness,

original: yon tan de yang dpal zhes rab tu bshad //üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: yon tan de yang dpal zhes rab tu bshad // ces gsungs so //
translated: that quality is also taught to be glory.

original: yang na thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung gi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: yang na thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung gi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin zhing /
translated: Or, whatever is the nature of the speech of the Omniscient One is the perfection of one‚Äôs own aim.

original: de'i rgyu can sde tshan gsum gyi rgyu ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can sde tshan gsum gyi rgyu ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The cause of the three categories is the perfection of the aims of others.

original: de gnyis ka ni dpal lo //
analyzed: de gnyis ka ni dpal lo //
translated: Both of these are glory.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la 'bad pa las thar pa thob pa ni bdud rtsi'o zhes so //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la 'bad pa las thar pa thob pa ni bdud rtsi'o zhes so //
translated: The attainment of liberation from striving for the perfection of one's own and others' aims and for the collections of merit and knowledge is nectar.

original: de nas bstan bcos gang zhig bsten pas skyes bu rnams kyi don sgrub par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas bstan bcos gang zhig bsten pas skyes bu rnams kyi don sgrub par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Then, it is said that one should rely on the treatise that accomplishes the aims of beings.

original: ming dang rtags rjes su bstan pa brjod par bya zhes te /
analyzed: ming dang rtags rjes su bstan pa brjod par bya zhes te /
translated: The explanation of the nominal and nominal suffixes should be stated.

original: thun mong pa'i rtags 'chad par 'dod pa nyid las ma ning gi rtags nyid kyi go rims med de /
analyzed: thun mong pa'i rtags 'chad par 'dod pa nyid las ma ning gi rtags nyid kyi go rims med de /
translated: The explanation of the common nominal suffixes is not in order, just as the neuter suffixes are not in order.

original: dper na / ngag gnyis kyis tshig gcig ces pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / ngag gnyis kyis tshig gcig ces pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like two statements that say one word.

original: mtho ris la sogs pa'i ming rnams la 'jug pa'i sgra gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtho ris la sogs pa'i ming rnams la 'jug pa'i sgra gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What are the terms that engage the names of the higher realms and so on?

original: byom la sogs pa rnams so zhes pas ma n'a'i byings las /
analyzed: byom la sogs pa rnams so zhes pas ma n'a'i byings las /
translated: The nominal suffixes are the nominal suffixes byoma and so on.

original: ma ning dang ma dbyi ba yang ngo //
analyzed: ma ning dang ma dbyi ba yang ngo //
translated: The nominal suffixes are also the neuter and feminine.

original: yang na na mi ste sgra yang don du ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na na mi ste sgra yang don du ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Or else, na is a human, and ma is a sound, because of the many meanings.

original: de bshad pa /
analyzed: de bshad pa /
translated: That is explained:

original: na ma rab tu 'dud pa dang sgra la'o zhes so //
analyzed: na ma rab tu 'dud pa dang sgra la'o zhes so //
translated: Na is bowing down, and ma is a sound.

original: 'dud par byed pa mngon par brjod pa la 'di yis n'a ma la snga ma bzhin ma ning la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dud par byed pa mngon par brjod pa la 'di yis n'a ma la snga ma bzhin ma ning la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the expression ‚Äúbowing down,‚Äù na is a neuter, etc., as before.

original: yang na rtags gang de'i pa dang aa tsal sogs pa rnams kyis gsal bar byed pa'i bud med la sogs pa'i rtags gang yin pa de ni bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning nyid do //
analyzed: yang na rtags gang de'i pa dang aa tsal sogs pa rnams kyis gsal bar byed pa'i bud med la sogs pa'i rtags gang yin pa de ni bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning nyid do //
translated: Or else, any sign that is made clear by those letters pa, a, ca, etc., is a sign of a woman, man, or neuter.

original: de dag rjes su ston pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: de dag rjes su ston pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: That is the treatise that teaches them.

original: ming dang rtags 'di dag gis @246b slob ma rnams la rjes su ston par byed cing bye brag tu rtogs par byed pas na brjod par bya zhes te nang gi de nyid kyis grub pa la phyi'i de nyid kyis rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang rtags 'di dag gis @246b slob ma rnams la rjes su ston par byed cing bye brag tu rtogs par byed pas na brjod par bya zhes te nang gi de nyid kyis grub pa la phyi'i de nyid kyis rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Since one teaches and causes understanding of those disciples by means of those names and signs, they are to be expressed. That is to say, having established the inner reality, one makes it clear by means of the outer reality.

original: yang na bsngags pa la 'byung 'gyur dang da ltar ba dang nye bar spyod pa las lata'o //
analyzed: yang na bsngags pa la 'byung 'gyur dang da ltar ba dang nye bar spyod pa las lata'o //
translated: Or else, it is from praise, from what has occurred, from what is present, and from what is enjoyed.

original: de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang /
translated: And in the same way,

original: 'jig rten na nges par 'byung ba bzhin grub pa la mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bo yang da ltar ba'i don bzhin nam yang na srid pa bzhin tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na nges par 'byung ba bzhin grub pa la mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bo yang da ltar ba'i don bzhin nam yang na srid pa bzhin tha snyad byed do //
translated: in the world, one speaks of a certain person as a certain thing, as one who has gone forth, as one who has attained, as one who is desired, as one who is present, or as one who is.

original: dper na / 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig 'chad de /
analyzed: dper na / 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig 'chad de /
translated: For example, one says of a certain person,

translated: ‚ÄúHe is mostly this.‚Äù

original: de nges par yod ces sems par byed pa dang / yang na phal cher thob ces so sor smra'o zhes so //
analyzed: de nges par yod ces sems par byed pa dang / yang na phal cher thob ces so sor smra'o zhes so //

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsngags pa byed pa la srid pa bzhin zhes shin tu bstan pa'i tshigs so sor 'chad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsngags pa byed pa la srid pa bzhin zhes shin tu bstan pa'i tshigs so sor 'chad do //
translated: For this very reason, the author of the treatise explains the verse, ‚ÄúIt is as if one were to speak of existence,‚Äù in order to praise the treatise.

original: 'o na sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyi ming dang rtags rjes su bstan pa'i phyir ci'i don du 'di rjod par byed ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyi ming dang rtags rjes su bstan pa'i phyir ci'i don du 'di rjod par byed ce na gsungs pa /
translated: But why is this stated in order to indicate the name and clan of the former teachers?üîΩHe says:

original: rgyud gzhan rnams las bsdus byas nas //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan rnams las bsdus byas nas //
translated: Having collected from the other treatises,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /

original: 'dir rgyud gzhan dang gzhan ni skabs gsum gyi mngon brjod kyi bstan bcos autpa li la sogs pa dang / slob dpon by'a d'i dang / mchog sred dang / tsandra go mi dang / b'a ma na la sogs pas bshad pa'i rtags kyi bstan bcos rnams yang dag par bsdus te phung por byas nas 'dir brjod pa yin no //

translated: Here, the treatises on verbal expression in the three contexts, such as the treatises on signs explained by the masters VƒÅtsyƒÅyana, B·πõhaspati, Candra-gomin, VƒÅmana, and so on, are compiled and collected, and then expressed here.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this is complete.

original: don gang ji snyed pa'i ming gang yin pa'i ming de thams cad rgyud gzhan rnams las yang dag par bsdus nas mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum gyi sde tshan gyis mtshon par byed do zhes pa'i don to //

translated: Subduer of Mara means he subdues the Mara of afflictions and so on, and the Mara of the desire realm, the lord of the mind.

original: dzi la kvi pa'o//
analyzed: dzi la kvi pa'o//
translated: It is Jilakavya.

original: 'jig rten ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rang bzhin te 'jig rten du rab tu grags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rang bzhin te 'jig rten du rab tu grags so //
translated: World means the nature of desire, form, and formlessness, well-known in the world.

original: yang na mtho ris la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: yang na mtho ris la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Or else, it means the nature of the higher realms and so on.

original: phul du byung bar 'dul bar byed pas dzi la kvi pa rkyen no //
analyzed: phul du byung bar 'dul bar byed pas dzi la kvi pa rkyen no //
translated: Since he subdues the world, he is the subduer of the world.

original: bdud 'dul bas na rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: bdud 'dul bas na rgyal ba'o //
translated: Since he subdues Mara, he is the victor.üîΩSince he is the subduer of the world and the victor, he is Jina.

original: r'a sna la sogs pa rnams so zhes pas dzi la na ka rkyen du'o //
analyzed: r'a sna la sogs pa rnams so zhes pas dzi la na ka rkyen du'o //
translated: Jina is the root, and kavya is the suffix.

original: lha'i spyan dang / lha'i snyan dang / pha rol gyi sems mkhyen pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa dang / nam mkha' la 'gro 'ong mdzad pa'i sku'i bkod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rdzu 'phrul rnams ni mngon shes drug go //
analyzed: lha'i spyan dang / lha'i snyan dang / pha rol gyi sems mkhyen pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa dang / nam mkha' la 'gro 'ong mdzad pa'i sku'i bkod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rdzu 'phrul rnams ni mngon shes drug go //
translated: The six higher perceptions are the divine eye, the divine ear, knowledge of the minds of others, recollection of past lives, knowledge of the exhaustion of contamination, and the ability to perform miracles such as displaying a body that can travel through space.

original: 'di'i stobs bcu rnams ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa ste lung las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i stobs bcu rnams ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa ste lung las shes par bya'o //
translated: The ten powers of a buddha are knowledge of what is possible and impossible, etc. They should be understood from the scriptures.

original: 'dir ni mangs pa'i 'jigs pas rgyas par ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dir ni mangs pa'i 'jigs pas rgyas par ma byas so //
translated: Here, I have not elaborated on them for fear of being excessive.

original: gnyis ma yin pa ni gnyis med de /
analyzed: gnyis ma yin pa ni gnyis med de /
translated: Nondual means nondifferent.

original: de kho na nyid gsung ba'i ngang tshul 'di la mnga' @256b bas gnyis med gsung ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsung ba'i ngang tshul 'di la mnga' @256b bas gnyis med gsung ba'o //
translated: The one who has mastery over this nature of teaching reality is the one who teaches nondually.

original: rigs ma yin pa las ngang tshul dang yang dag yang dag la'o zhes pas ba da la ni ni'o //
analyzed: rigs ma yin pa las ngang tshul dang yang dag yang dag la'o zhes pas ba da la ni ni'o //
translated: The suffix -ana is added to the root bhƒÅ·π£a, meaning to speak, and the negative particle a is added to the root arha, meaning to be worthy, to form the compound abhƒÅ·π£ya.

original: sems can rnams 'dul bar mdzad cing phan pa rjes su ston par mdzad pas rnam 'dren te /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'dul bar mdzad cing phan pa rjes su ston par mdzad pas rnam 'dren te /
translated: The one who guides sentient beings and teaches them what is beneficial is the guide.

original: n'i la / n'u la'o //
analyzed: n'i la / n'u la'o //
translated: Nila. Nulo.

original: thub pa rnams kyi rgyal por gyur pas na thub dbang ngo //
analyzed: thub pa rnams kyi rgyal por gyur pas na thub dbang ngo //
translated: Since he is the king of the sages, he is the lord of sages.

original: dpal gyis gang bas na dpal stug ste /
analyzed: dpal gyis gang bas na dpal stug ste /
translated: Since he is filled with glory, he is glorious.

original: kshu bhn'a sv'a h'a las tshig snga ma las ming la'o zhes pas nan nyid do //
analyzed: kshu bhn'a sv'a h'a las tshig snga ma las ming la'o zhes pas nan nyid do //
translated: Since the previous word is a name, it is a name, as in Kshubhanasvaha.üîΩAnd it is explained:

original: de yang / dpe byad brgyad cu'i rin po che yis bkra //
analyzed: de yang / dpe byad brgyad cu'i rin po che yis bkra //
translated: Adorned with the jewels of the eighty minor marks,

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan (bi n'a ya) gyis mtshan pa gang //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan (bi n'a ya) gyis mtshan pa gang //
translated: Marked with the thirty-two major marks,

original: de ni tshangs min lha bdag rnams kyi min //
analyzed: de ni tshangs min lha bdag rnams kyi min //
translated: He is not Brahma, nor the lord of the gods,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dpal gyi sku //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dpal gyi sku // zhes bshad do //
translated: The glorious body of the Tathagatas.

original: stug po ni tshogs pa ste des byas pa'i phyir byed pa po'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: stug po ni tshogs pa ste des byas pa'i phyir byed pa po'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: Dense means a collection, and since it is made by that, it is a collection of agents.

original: sems can rnams la ston cing 'dul bar byed pas na byed pa po la zhes pas tri tsa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la ston cing 'dul bar byed pas na byed pa po la zhes pas tri tsa'o //
translated: Since he teaches and disciplines sentient beings, he is an agent, as in Trita.

original: de bzhin du kti ti shi la zhes pa 'dir sh'ast'a zhes dper brjod so sor byas pas 'di nyid la yang na tri tsa bshad ces ratna ma ti'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kti ti shi la zhes pa 'dir sh'ast'a zhes dper brjod so sor byas pas 'di nyid la yang na tri tsa bshad ces ratna ma ti'o //
translated: Similarly, here in Kshantisila, since the example is stated separately as Sastra, this is also explained as Trita, as in Ratnamati.

original: de nyid kyi phyir a'a pa tri sogs nyid las ring po nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir a'a pa tri sogs nyid las ring po nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is long by virtue of itself.

original: sh'ast'a roo / shast'a ram /
analyzed: sh'ast'a roo / shast'a ram /
translated: Sastara, sastaram.

original: de ni rigs kho na nges pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ni rigs kho na nges pa la 'jug ste /
translated: This is the mere determination of the class,

original: dper na bram ze koondi n+ya nyid zas za bas bram ze zas za ba mi 'gog par rgyal rigs la sogs pa za ba 'gog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bram ze koondi n+ya nyid zas za bas bram ze zas za ba mi 'gog par rgyal rigs la sogs pa za ba 'gog pa bzhin no //
translated: just as when it is said that Ka·πá·∏ça the Brahmin eats, it is not that the Brahmin does not eat when he eats, but that he does not eat the food of the k·π£atriya class and so on.

original: de kho na rgyud rab tu gsal bar slob dpon srung bas bshad do //
analyzed: de kho na rgyud rab tu gsal bar slob dpon srung bas bshad do //
translated: This is clearly explained in the continuum of that very masterüîΩ.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyogs la tshig 'di dag ni st'a sogs smos pa tshig nges pa'i don du bshad pa des ming gi sgra nyid las gzhan ma yin pa la 'jug go zhes so //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyogs la tshig 'di dag ni st'a sogs smos pa tshig nges pa'i don du bshad pa des ming gi sgra nyid las gzhan ma yin pa la 'jug go zhes so //
translated: In the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position, these words are explained to have the meaning of a definitive word.

original: sngon gyi drang srong las so zhes pa'i shes byed las lung las bstan pa rnams la zhes pa'i don la zhes pas bod rkyen no //
analyzed: sngon gyi drang srong las so zhes pa'i shes byed las lung las bstan pa rnams la zhes pa'i don la zhes pas bod rkyen no //
translated: The word ‚Äúfrom‚Äù in ‚Äúfrom the former ·πõ·π£is‚Äù is a Tibetan particle that has the meaning of ‚Äúin the scriptures that are taught.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad mkhyen (tshi'o) pa'am yang na thub pa bzhin du chos mi gsung bas thub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad mkhyen (tshi'o) pa'am yang na thub pa bzhin du chos mi gsung bas thub pa'o //
translated: He is the Muni, the Sage, because he is omniscient in every way, or because he does not speak about things as the Muni did.

original: ma ni las au ta kyang ngo zhes pas ai'i rkyen dang aa ta'i au ta nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: ma ni las au ta kyang ngo zhes pas ai'i rkyen dang aa ta'i au ta nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The letter ma is the cause of the letter i, and the letter a is the cause of the letter u.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dpag tu med pa rnams ni lung las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dpag tu med pa rnams ni lung las shes par bya ste /
translated: The Buddha's immeasurable qualities are to be known from the scriptures.

original: 'di rnams sangs rgyas spyi tsam gyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'di rnams sangs rgyas spyi tsam gyi rnam grangs so //
translated: These are the synonyms of the Buddha in general.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i mtshan no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i mtshan no //
translated: One verse on the name of the perfect Buddha Sakyamuni.

original: sh'akya'i rigs su 'khrungs pa'i phyir nas sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba la sogs @257a * //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs su 'khrungs pa'i phyir nas sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba la sogs @257a * //
translated: He is called the Buddha Sakyamuni because he was born in the Shakya family, and so on.

original: pa ste ; bu ram shing pa'i rigs las byung ba'i rgyal po ke tsa na zhes bya'i bu phas nags su bskrad de /
analyzed: pa ste ; bu ram shing pa'i rigs las byung ba'i rgyal po ke tsa na zhes bya'i bu phas nags su bskrad de /
translated: The son of King Kansa, who was born in the sugarcane family, was banished to the forest by his father.

original: nags de na thub pa ser skya zhes bya ba la brten nas shing sh'aka zhes bya ba'i drung du gnas bcas te ser skya'i slob mar gyur te rig pa dang ldan no //

translated: In that forest, he took up residence at the foot of a pippala tree, relying on the sage Kapila, and became a student of Kapila, mastering the Vedas.

original: des na sh'akya ste /
analyzed: des na sh'akya ste /
translated: Therefore, he was a Shakya.

original: di ka sogs nyid las yata'o //
analyzed: di ka sogs nyid las yata'o //
translated: The suffix yat is added to the root of the name of the clan, such as this and so on.

original: de yang mdzes shing dga' ba'i spyod pa'i snyan dngags las /üîΩsh'ak'i shing gis khebs pa yi //
analyzed: de yang mdzes shing dga' ba'i spyod pa'i snyan dngags las / sh'ak'i shing gis khebs pa yi //
translated: Moreover, it is said in the poetry of beautiful and delightful conduct:

original: gnas su gang phyir 'chag byed pa //
analyzed: gnas su gang phyir 'chag byed pa //
translated: Because he walked in the placeüîΩcovered with pippala trees,

original: de phyir bu ram shing rigs las //
analyzed: de phyir bu ram shing rigs las //
translated: he came from the sugarcane clan

original: byung ste sh'akya zhes su bshad //
analyzed: byung ste sh'akya zhes su bshad //
translated: and is known as a Shakya.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sh'akya'i rigs las 'khrungs pas sh'akya yang 'di yin la thub pa yang yin pas sh'akya thub pa ste /
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs las 'khrungs pas sh'akya yang 'di yin la thub pa yang yin pas sh'akya thub pa ste /
translated: He is a Shakya because he was born in the Shakya clan, and he is a sage, so he is a Shakya sage.

original: khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is a special compound.

original: sh'akya seng ge ni sh'akya'i gtso bo'o //
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge ni sh'akya'i gtso bo'o //
translated: The Shakya Lion is the chief of the Shakyas.

original: 'di 'khrungs ma thag tu rin po che'i gter dag byung zhing don thams cad grub pas don grub ces mtshan du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'khrungs ma thag tu rin po che'i gter dag byung zhing don thams cad grub pas don grub ces mtshan du byas pa'o //

translated: The Buddha is called ‚Äúpure-rice‚Äù because he is the son of the pure-rice family.üîΩThe

original: des na bla ma'i rigs dang ldan pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: des na bla ma'i rigs dang ldan pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Therefore, he is also called the guru of the kshatriya caste.

original: de yang mdzes dga'i spyod pa las //
analyzed: de yang mdzes dga'i spyod pa las //
translated: The Conduct of Beauty and Joy states:

original: de ni bla ma kootsha'i rigs //
analyzed: de ni bla ma kootsha'i rigs //

original: de las byung ba goo ta ma //
analyzed: de las byung ba goo ta ma //
translated: Gautama arose from that caste.

original: zhes bshad do //üîΩji skad du /
analyzed: zhes bshad do // ji skad du /
translated: It is said:üîΩThe one who gives food, protects from fear,

original: zas ster 'jigs pa skyob pa dang // gang yin rig pa sbyin byed dang // skyed par byed dang bag ster pa //
analyzed: zas ster 'jigs pa skyob pa dang // gang yin rig pa sbyin byed dang // skyed par byed dang bag ster pa //
translated: gives knowledge, gives birth, and gives pleasure,

original: lnga po de de rnams pa zhes bya //
analyzed: lnga po de de rnams pa zhes bya //
translated: these five are called the five types of gurus.

original: zhes dran pa'i gzhung la brten nas so //
analyzed: zhes dran pa'i gzhung la brten nas so //
translated: This is based on the text of the recollection of the five types of gurus.

original: bu rgyud kyi rkyen 'chad par 'dod pa la ri shi /
analyzed: bu rgyud kyi rkyen 'chad par 'dod pa la ri shi /
translated: For those who wish to explain the condition of the lineage of the son, there is rishi,üîΩkurva,

original: ku ru / brishni /
analyzed: ku ru / brishni /
translated: and andhaka.

original: aandha ka las aa na'o //
analyzed: aandha ka las aa na'o //
translated: From andhaka, there is ana.

original: de'i tshe aa tri (rgyun shes) dang bhri gu ngan spong la sogs pa mang po la bud med min pa la 'jigs @257b pas goo ta ma'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe aa tri (rgyun shes) dang bhri gu ngan spong la sogs pa mang po la bud med min pa la 'jigs @257b pas goo ta ma'o //
translated: At that time, many such as Atri, Bhrigu, and Angiras were called Gautama because they feared being called women.

analyzed: ji ltar bha ra ta'i slob ma rnams kyi bu rgyud 'chad par 'dod pa la /

original: autpa sogs la aa nya dang aa nya dang ai nya rnams mang po rnams la bud med min pa la zhes pas 'jigs pas zhes so //
analyzed: autpa sogs la aa nya dang aa nya dang ai nya rnams mang po rnams la bud med min pa la zhes pas 'jigs pas zhes so //
translated: In the case of utpala, etc., the a, a, and i are many. In the case of the feminine, the a is not. By fear means by fear.

original: dza na skye ba dang ta no ti dang ka ro ta li bi tsa'o //
analyzed: dza na skye ba dang ta no ti dang ka ro ta li bi tsa'o //
translated: Jana is birth, and tanoti and karotati are to make.

original: dza ni ta /
analyzed: dza ni ta /
translated: Jana is jani.

original: tri tsa las au na la aita dbyi ba med pas dza na yi t'a zhes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tri tsa las au na la aita dbyi ba med pas dza na yi t'a zhes par 'gyur ro //
translated: From tricala, unala is obtained. Since there is no elision of the i, it becomes janiti.

original: nyi ma'i gnyen dang lha mo sgyu 'phrul sras rnams te rgyas par lung las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i gnyen dang lha mo sgyu 'phrul sras rnams te rgyas par lung las shes par bya'o //
translated: The sons of the Sun's friend and the goddess Maya are to be known in detail from the scriptures.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis tshangs pa ste 'di'i lus kyi tshad /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis tshangs pa ste 'di'i lus kyi tshad /
translated: In two verses, Brahma. This is the measure of his body.

original: tshad med cing khyad par du 'phags pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshad med cing khyad par du 'phags pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is immeasurable and exalted.

original: bri ha ta rgya che ba'o zhes bshad pas tshangs pa zhes s'amba su r'a na las bshad do //
analyzed: bri ha ta rgya che ba'o zhes bshad pas tshangs pa zhes s'amba su r'a na las bshad do //
translated: Since it is explained that brihat means great, it is explained from the Brahma Sutra.

original: byo ma la sogs pa rnams so zhes pas bri hi las ma ning dang nam a'a ga ma yang ngo //
analyzed: byo ma la sogs pa rnams so zhes pas bri hi las ma ning dang nam a'a ga ma yang ngo //
translated: The yoma, etc., means from brihi, the neuter and the feminine.

original: de ni tshangs pa zhes btags te de'i lus kyi tshad khyab 'jug gis steng nas mar bltas /
analyzed: de ni tshangs pa zhes btags te de'i lus kyi tshad khyab 'jug gis steng nas mar bltas /
translated: He was called Brahma.

original: dbang phyug gis 'og na yar bltas kyang ma rnyed do zhes grag go //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis 'og na yar bltas kyang ma rnyed do zhes grag go //
translated: Vishnu looked down from above and Ishvara looked up from below, but they could not find the end of his body.

original: bdag skyes ni las kyi rlung gis ma 'phangs pas te kvi pa rkyen no //

analyzed: brgya byin gyi rdo rjes bsnun nas rkang pa bcad pas de tshun chad 'gro ma shes so //

analyzed: m'i na zhes pa'i ri ni bros nas rgya mtsho'i nang na yod do zhes grag go //

analyzed: rdo rje mtshon cha dang dbyig ni rin po che la sogs pa'i nor dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: yu ba las ka ni na'o //

analyzed: b'a sto: ni gnas te sa'o //

original: bdag po ni lhag par gnas pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: bdag po ni lhag par gnas pa'i lha'o //

analyzed: tshig phrad las drug pa mi 'jig pas sa'i yang sha nyid de b'asto ....(gnas bdag) shpa ti'o //

analyzed: yang khang pa la sogs pa'i gzhi rnams kyi bdag po brgya byin te /

analyzed: de brtsig pa'i tshe na brgya byin las blangs na byin gyis rlob cing ster bar 'gyur ro zhes so //

original: lha rnams kyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi bdag po'o //
translated: He is the lord of the gods.

original: lha ma yin stobs ldan dang 'phel ba dang rmugs byed dang grol med ces pa rnams bsad pas dgra'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin stobs ldan dang 'phel ba dang rmugs byed dang grol med ces pa rnams bsad pas dgra'o //

original: legs brjod ma ni brgya byin gyi chung ma ste dbyangs shin tu snyan pa'o //
analyzed: legs brjod ma ni brgya byin gyi chung ma ste dbyangs shin tu snyan pa'o //

original: des na legs brjod bdag go //
analyzed: des na legs brjod bdag go //

original: 'phrog byed rta ni brgya byin kho na'i rta ste ha ri dang ka na ka dang singga la rnams 'di'i @269b rta'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phrog byed rta ni brgya byin kho na'i rta ste ha ri dang ka na ka dang singga la rnams 'di'i @269b rta'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The horse of Indra is called the horse of Indra. It is said that Hari, Kanaka, and Singhala are its horses.

original: mtho ris kyi rgyal po ste /
analyzed: mtho ris kyi rgyal po ste /
translated: He is the king of the heavens.

original: sva: r'a dza ti la kvi pa dang snga ma bzhin ra dbyi ba dang ring po'o //
analyzed: sva: r'a dza ti la kvi pa dang snga ma bzhin ra dbyi ba dang ring po'o //
translated: The word sva is the king, and the word raja is as before.

original: na yig pha rol las au yig gi nyam pha rol la nyam yang na'o zhes pa'i phyogs la na nyid do //
analyzed: na yig pha rol las au yig gi nyam pha rol la nyam yang na'o zhes pa'i phyogs la na nyid do //

original: na to ra na ba ti zhes pas na'i yu nyid med do //
analyzed: na to ra na ba ti zhes pas na'i yu nyid med do //

analyzed: aika mtha' nye las zhes pa sa ki'o //

original: na kha sogs kyi phyir na dbyi ba med do //
analyzed: na kha sogs kyi phyir na dbyi ba med do //

analyzed: de 'joms par byed do la nandi sogs las lyu'o //

original: yang dag tu zhes pa ni lha ma yin gyi ma dee tya zhes pa'i bu thams cad brgya byin gyis bsad pas ma dga' nas drang srong 'od srung zhes pa la bsnyen bkur mang du byas pas /
analyzed: yang dag tu zhes pa ni lha ma yin gyi ma dee tya zhes pa'i bu thams cad brgya byin gyis bsad pas ma dga' nas drang srong 'od srung zhes pa la bsnyen bkur mang du byas pas /
translated: As for truly, the mother of the asura, named Daityƒ´, was unhappy because all her sons were killed by Indra. She made much service to the sage named KƒÅ≈õyapa.

original: de na re khyod ci 'dod zer bas brgya byin thub pa'i bu gcig 'dod zer ro //
analyzed: de na re khyod ci 'dod zer bas brgya byin thub pa'i bu gcig 'dod zer ro //
translated: He said, What do you desire? She said, I desire a son who can defeat Indra.

original: des chu thigs pa cig byin te mngal du bzung ngo //
analyzed: des chu thigs pa cig byin te mngal du bzung ngo //

original: de brgya byin gyis thos nas da lta nyid du med par bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: de brgya byin gyis thos nas da lta nyid du med par bya'o zhes zer te /

analyzed: de'i mngal du zhugs nas de dum bu bdun du byas kyang ma shi bas dus so //

original: yang khros te de re re yang bdun bdun du byas so //
analyzed: yang khros te de re re yang bdun bdun du byas so //

original: de dag lhan cig tu rlung gi lha bzhi bcu rtsa dgur gyur te /
analyzed: de dag lhan cig tu rlung gi lha bzhi bcu rtsa dgur gyur te /

original: der ma na re shin tu du'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: der ma na re shin tu du'o zhes zer ro //

analyzed: des ni phyi rol pa rnams kyis brgya byin gyi go 'phang thob par 'dod do //

analyzed: de'i phyir bzod dkas rengs zhes bha ra ta'i gtam las smras so //

analyzed: kun 'joms ni pha rol gyi stobs thams cad brgya byin gyis 'joms pa ste /

analyzed: bri sha la sogs rnams las kyang ngo zhes pas ka la rkyen no //

analyzed: mig stong ni drang srong goo ta ma'i chung ma shol med ma zhes bya ba shin tu sdug cing yid du 'ong ba cig yod pa la /

analyzed: shing gi khong seng du sbas pas de mi dga' nas /

analyzed: der drang srong 'ong ba dang 'doms nas de'i mngal du zhugs so //
translated: When the sage returned, he was hidden in her womb.

analyzed: der su 'ongs zhes dris pa dang su 'ang ma 'ongs so zhes zer ro //
